title: Enable self-service password reset for DB users
content:
As the suite admin, you can enable the self-service password reset feature for a tenant. Once this feature is enabled, a Forgot your password? link is available on the Service Portal and agent portal login pages, and users of the DB type can click this link to reset their password on their own. 

Note
  • This feature is only for users of the DB type. 
  • This feature doesn't unlock or activate users. A locked or inactive user is still locked or inactive after a password reset. 

To enable this feature for a tenant, perform the following steps as the suite admin:

  1. In Suite Administration, open the tenant record, and click the IdM settings tab to open the IdM Admin Portal.
  2. Click Customization on the left pane, and select the FORGOTTEN PASSWORDS tab.
  3. Select the Enable Forget Password checkbox.
  4. Configure an SMTP mail server for sending password reset emails to users. 
    1. Complete the following fields:
      • Email Address From: enter an email address, which will be displayed as the sender in the password reset email sent to users.
      • Email Hostname and Email Port: Enter your SMTP mail server's hostname and port number. 
      • Email Password and Email Authentication User: if you're using authenticated SMTP to send emails, enter the password and user name of your authentication user account. If your mail server doesn't require authentication, leave these fields blank. 
    2. If your mail server requires a proxy, select the Enable Email Proxy checkbox, and then enter the proxy server and port in the Email Host Proxy and Email Proxy Port fields. If your mail server doesn't require a proxy, skip this step.
    3. If your SMTP mail server supports StartTLS  and Userset, select the Enable startTLS and Enable Userset checkboxes.
  5. Configure the password reset email settings:
    1. In the Forgotten Password Email Body field, the email body contains two parameters: 
      •  {{CODE}}: This parameter defines the verification code sent with each email. It's not customizable. 
      • {{VALIDITY}}: This parameter defines the validity period of the verification code sent with each email. By default, it's 5 minutes. If you want to change from the default value, go to Global settings > System Settings > Others and change the Validity of code in password reset email value.
    2.   In the Forgotten Password Email Subject field, enter a subject. For example: Reset your Service Management Automation password.
  6. Click Save.

Now, you can verify the configuration. For more information, see Self-service password reset for DB users.
